alert.note: Alert for Curry County; Quay County; Roosevelt County (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 01 at 5:42PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT NORTHWESTERN ROOSEVELT...SOUTH CENTRAL QUAY AND WEST CENTRAL CURRY COUNTIES THROUGH 615 PM MDT... At 542 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Tolar, or 19 miles east of Fort Sumner, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... House and Mcalister. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. Motorists can expect brief but sudden changes in visibility and ponding of water on highways as storms move through the area.

area.areaDesc: Curry County; Quay County; Roosevelt County
